column4: The Screen Resolution app in system->preferences (in gnome) doesnt list the correct resolutions for my screen (its widescreen), so can i set it in another way?
are you using an nvidia?
yes, 6800gt
the nvidia drivers have a bug which scrambles the refresh rate listings, that might be your problem
anyone know how to make a suggestion for ubotu?
well if that bug spills over to screen resolutions, but the refresh rate works fine
no, i think its just refresh rates
SHOULD 'Screen Resolution' app list widescreen res's?
I mean, not should as in usability, but as in how its made currently
are you switching monitors by chance?
well yeah, but i switched gpu at the same time, from ati to nvidia, required an install of nvidia drivers and a reboot
anyway, you can use the command sudo dpkg-reconfigure -phigh xserver-org
used the proprietary drivers app for that
yeah, you need to reconfigure every time you switch monitors
is it scary?
i believe
not if you know the specs of your monitor, which it sounds like you do
!spanish | ubuntu
It says "Package `xserver-org' is not installed..." but that sounds strange..
er, i don't know the package for sure, use tab complete
xserver-xorg ?
hmm?
